sen.j: 丹後半島（たんごはんとう）は、京都府北部の日本海に北東に突き出た半島。
sen.e: The Tango Peninsula is a peninsula in the north of Kyoto Prefecture, thrusting northeast into the Sea of Japan.
The Tango Peninsula is a peninsula in the north of Kyoto Prefecture, thrusting northeast into the Sea of Japan.
The Tango Peninsula is a peninsula in the north of Kyoto Prefecture, thrusting northeast into the Sea of Japan.

sen.j: 与謝半島（よさはんとう）、奥丹後半島（おくたんごはんとう）ともいう。
sen.e: It is also called Yosa Peninsula or Okutango Peninsula.
It is also called Yosa Peninsula or Okutango Peninsula.
It is also called Yosa Peninsula or Okutango Peninsula.

sen.j: 海岸など一部は、丹後天橋立大江山国定公園に含まれる。
sen.e: The part of the Tango Peninsula, such as coasts, belongs to the Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park.
Parts of the Tango Peninsula, such as it's coasts, belong to the Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park.
Parts of the Tango Peninsula, such as it's coasts, belong to the Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park.

sen.j: 京都府京丹後市と与謝郡伊根町の全域、与謝郡与謝野町と宮津市の一部が含まれる。
sen.e: The Tango Peninsula includes the entire region of Tango City and Ine-cho, Yosa-gun in Kyoto Prefecture as well as part of Miyazu City and Yosano-cho, Yoza-gun.
The Tango Peninsula includes the entire region of Tango City and Ine-cho, Yosa-gun in Kyoto Prefecture as well as part of Miyazu City and Yosano-cho, Yoza-gun.
The Tango Peninsula includes the entire region of Kyotango City and Ine-cho, Yosa-gun as well as part of Miyazu City and Yosano-cho, Yosa-gun, all of which are in Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 京都府の場所を変更しました。京丹後 としました。

sen.j: 丹後半島北端にある経ヶ岬から、越前海岸にある越前岬をもって若狭湾を形成する。
sen.e: Wakasa Bay lies between Cape Kyoga-misaki on the northern edge of the Tango Peninsula and Cape Echizen-misaki on the Echizen Coast.
Wakasa Bay lies between Cape Kyoga-misaki on the northern edge of the Tango Peninsula and Cape Echizen-misaki on the Echizen Coast.
Wakasa Bay lies between Cape Kyoga-misaki on the northern edge of the Tango Peninsula and Cape Echizen-misaki on the Echizen Coast.

sen.j: 丹後半島の東端は新井崎。
sen.e: Nizaki is located on the eastern edge of the Tango Peninsula.
Nizaki is located on the eastern edge of the Tango Peninsula.
Nizaki is located on the eastern edge of the Tango Peninsula.

sen.j: 半島南東部の付け根付近では天橋立が伸び、宮津湾から阿蘇海を形成している。
sen.e: Amanohashidate (sand bar) stretches over at the base of the peninsula, forming the Aso-kai (inland sea), being detached from Miyazu Bay.
Amanohashidate (sand bar) stretches over at the base of the peninsula, forming the Aso-kai (inland sea), being detached from Miyazu Bay.
Amanohashidate (sand bar) stretches over at the base of the southeastern part of the peninsula, forming the Aso-kai (inland sea), being detached from Miyazu Bay.
sen.cmt: 南東 を追加しました。

sen.j: なお、京都府では有数の降雪地帯となっている。
sen.e: Incidentally, the Tango Peninsula is one of the most snowy areas in Kyoto Prefecture.
Incidentally, the Tango Peninsula is one of the snowiest areas in Kyoto Prefecture.
Incidentally, the Tango Peninsula is one of the snowiest areas in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 古代より大陸との交流が盛んな所で近年の考古学的発掘によりこの地方に一大勢力があったことが確認されている。
sen.e: The region on the Tango Peninsula has had close contacts with the Asian continent since ancient times, and archaeological excavations in recent years have shown that powerful clans existed in the region.
Areas on the Tango Peninsula have had close contact with the Asian continent since ancient times, and archaeological excavations in recent years have shown that powerful clans existed in the region.
Areas on the Tango Peninsula have had close contact with the Asian continent since ancient times, and archaeological excavations in recent years have shown that powerful clans existed in the region.

sen.j: 丹後地方では江戸時代中期より絹織物が発達し、丹後ちりめんとして有名。
sen.e: In Tango region, silk weaving, known as the Tango chirimen (silk crepe), has developed since the middle of the Edo period.
In Tango region, silk weaving, known as the Tango chirimen (silk crepe), developed since the middle of the Edo period.
In Tango region, silk weaving, known as the Tango chirimen (silk crepe), developed since the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 観光地や景勝地が多く、夏は海水浴、冬はカニ料理を目当てに訪れる観光客で賑わう。
sen.e: There are many tourist and scenic spots on the Tango Peninsula, attracting many tourists for sea bathing in summer and crab dishes in winter.
There are many tourist and scenic spots on the Tango Peninsula, attracting many tourists who bathe in the sea in summer, and enjoy crab dishes in winter.
There are many tourist and scenic spots on the Tango Peninsula, attracting many tourists who bathe in the sea in summer, and enjoy crab dishes in winter.

sen.j: おもに東岸部では、朝鮮半島や中国大陸などからの漂着物が多い。
sen.e: A variety of things from the Korean Peninsula and the mainland China are washed ashore on the eastern coast of the peninsula.
A variety of things from the Korean Peninsula and mainland China are washed ashore on the eastern coast of the peninsula.
A variety of things from the Korean Peninsula and mainland China are washed ashore on the eastern coast of the peninsula.
